summary: The concept of "school canteen" falls under the category of "organisation of teaching" within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. School canteens play a pivotal role in promoting healthy eating habits among students, aligning with EU initiatives aimed at enhancing nutritional standards in educational institutions. Regulations may stipulate the provision of balanced meals, thereby supporting the overall well-being of children and fostering an environment conducive to learning. Furthermore, the integration of school canteens within educational policies reflects the EU's commitment to social inclusion and public health, ensuring that all students have access to nutritious food during school hours.
